subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00C7_01C862C8.982A9D50
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I haven't started box recording yet.  My impression of the EVP I've capture=
d (which has been almost entirely obtained on the property I moved to six y=
ears ago) is that someone is attached to this place.  The first message was=
 "Here come some people," as I was hiking up the hill one day with my goats=
, then a kill-you threat in the house, then "get out of here" in the barn. =
 I assumed it must be one of the original owners, and I still feel that it'=
s mainly one spirit communicating that this is their home, not mine.  I've =
gotten one uplifting message from what I believe to be the same entity, and=
 this is also the last recording I've gotten.  I asked what death is like, =
compared to life: happy, beautiful, fulfilling--and specifically if death i=
s less depressing.  The response was "It's everything."  S/he/it basically =
stopped talking after that, and I stopped trying.  I know this sounds weird=
, but I miss whoever or whatever it was.  I wonder if some of us might be b=
etter at dealing with the low-life stuck or grounded entities rather than t=
he highly evolved technicians coming through the more sophisticated equipme=
nt.  I wonder where this is all going ultimately, other than to prove commu=
nication across the veil is possible.  I'm not an engineer or technologist =
on this physical plane, and I question what I have to offer this research s=
ince I'm so electronically challenged.  Meanwhile, the nurse side of me wan=
ts to heal and "fix" anyone needing help, even if they happen to be in the =
next world!  Do the guides and technicians ever acknowledge or make referen=
ce to the earthbound spirits, and if so, in what context?  Are we ever able=
 to help unstick the stuck ones?  Are we supposed to ignore them?   

Robin=



  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: LC Duplatt<mailto:lcdupla@yahoo.=
com> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent=
: Tuesday, January 29, 2008 3:32 AM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP


  EVP:

=
  Not that this is always the case, but EVP seems to primarily capture 
  l=
ost people - ghosts being recorded, versus the box having the 
  ability to=
 capture primarily what seems to be higher communication 
  from spirits, (=
and less of the lower communication - ghosts jumping 
  in).

  That to me =
is a huge difference... ;)

  LC
  http://www.AngelsGhosts.com<http://www.a=
ngelsghosts.com/>

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoog=
roups.com>, "ecuyler" <ecuyler@...> wrote:
  >
  > I agree about the differ=
ence also. All that review time makes for a
  > very tedious few hours. By =
the end of it you're ready to pull your
  > hair out. I've only done two se=
ssions now and have gotten more
  > positive results in 20 minutes time as =
I have in 10 years of EVP 
  research.
  > 
  > Jeremy
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
=
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogro=
ups.com>, Lisby <lisby@> wrote:
  > >
  > > Very interested. And I agree wi=
th you about the overnight 
  change. 
  > > Orgs like AA-EVP that aren't d=
ealing with the boxes are missing 
  the 
  > > boat.
  > > 
  > > Ann
  > =
> 
  > > On Jan 28, 2008, at 8:48 PM, Jules wrote:
  > > 
  > > > Well guys=
, I have to tell you that since I started box sessions 
  in
  > > > Novemb=
er I have become so spoiled that conventional EVP just 
  don't do
  > > > =
it for me.
  > > >
  > > > My organization was asked to come and do an inve=
stigation at a 
  very
  > > > historial place (here in Illinois). The owne=
r of this home 
  asked if I
  > > > would bring one of the boxes to the ho=
me (he is amazed with the
  > > > immediately 2 way communication). So upon=
 respectfully asking 
  my tec
  > > > if it was alright to do a session ou=
tside the my home we did 
  several
  > > > box sessions along with convent=
ional EVP. We wanted to see if 
  we could
  > > > discover some unanswered=
 history about the residence, and the 
  > > > otherside
  > > > was more t=
han willing to comply.
  > > >
  > > > I have to tell you that the regular =
EVP recordings were and are 
  the
  > > > most boring data to review. Some=
thing I use to love so much has
  > > > actually turned into a project give=
n I am waiting for a response
  > > > immediately! Too funny how things can=
 change overnight!
  > > >
  > > > I will be uploading some files for these=
 sessions if you are 
  > > > interested.
  > > >
  > > > Juli
  > > >
  > =
> >
  > > >
  > >
